item.title: Updating an Debian/Ubuntu OS that is no longer supported
item.description: In our example, we have Debian Squeeze (6.0) and it's been unsupported since Feb 2016. We can no longer install nor update the packages until you point it to another source...the archives. So, in /etc/apt/sources.list, add you will see: 1deb http://ftp.us.debian.org/debian/ squeeze main 2deb-src http://ftp.us.debian.org/debian/ squeeze main Replace it with: 1deb http://archive.debian.org/debian squeeze main 2deb http://archive.debian.org/debian squeeze-lts main and you can now access 'apt-get' or 'dpkg' as before (but limited to what's in the archive).
